hadiths.arabic: 6153. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : غَسلُ الإناءِ وكَسحُ الفِناءِ، مَجلَبَةٌ للرِّزقِ
hadiths.english: 6153. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Washing dishes and sweeping the courtyard attracts sustenance.'

hadiths.arabic: 6154. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : مِن أخلاقِ الأنبياءِ التَّنَظُّفُ
hadiths.english: 6154. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'From the morals of the prophets is cleanliness.'

hadiths.arabic: 6155. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : بِئسَ العَبدُ القاذُورَةُ
hadiths.english: 6155. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'How wretched is the servant who is filthy.'

hadiths.arabic: 6156. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : هَلَكَ المُتَقذَّرونَ
hadiths.english: 6156. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The filthy ones perish.'

hadiths.arabic: 6157. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تُؤْوُا التُّرابَ خَلفَ البابِ ؛ فإنّهُ مَأوَى الشَّيطانِ
hadiths.english: 6157. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do not place dirt behind the door, for it is the shelter of the devil.'

hadiths.arabic: 6158. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تُبَيِّتوا القُمامَةَ في بُيوتِكُم وأخرِجوها نَهاراً ؛ فإنّها مَقعَدُ الشَّيطانِ
hadiths.english: 6158. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do not leave garbage overnight in your houses, and take it out in the daytime, for it is the dwelling place of the devil.'

hadiths.arabic: 6159. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : تَنَظّفوا بالماءِ مِن النَّتنِ الرِّيحِ الّذي يُتأذّى‏ بِهِ ، تَعَهَّدوا أنفُسَكُم ؛ فإنّ اللَّهَ عَزَّوجلَّ يُبغِضُ مِن عِبادِهِ القاذُورَةَ الّذي يَتأنَّفُ بهِ مَن جَلَسَ إلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 6159. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Clean yourselves with water from the bad smells that are offensive, and attend to yourselves; for Allah Almighty hates the dirty from among His servants whose seating companions become disdained as a result of him.'

hadiths.arabic: 6160. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : نَظِّفوا بُيوتَكُم مِن حَوكِ العَنكَبوتِ ؛ فإنَّ تَركَهُ في البَيتِ يُورِثُ الفَقرَ
hadiths.english: 6160. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Clean your houses of cobwebs, for leaving them in the house brings about poverty.'

sections.section_title_en: THE BOUNTIES OF ALLAH CANNOT BE ENUMERATED

hadiths.arabic: 6161. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن لَم يَرَ للَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ علَيهِ نِعمَةً إلّا في مَطعَمٍ أو مَشرَبٍ أو مَلبَسٍ ، فقد قَصُرَ عَملُهُ ودنا عَذابُهُ
hadiths.english: 6161. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He who does not see the bounties of Allah upon himself other than in his food, drink, and clothes, surely his actions fall short and his punishment is near.'

hadiths.arabic: 6162. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: الحَمدُ للَّهِ الذي لا يَبلُغُ مِدحَتَهُ القائلونَ ، ولا يُحصِي نَعماءَهُ العادُّونَ
hadiths.english: 6162. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Praise be to Allah whose extolment speakers cannot attain, and whose bounties cannot be enumerated by those who count.'

hadiths.arabic: 6163. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في وَصيَّتِهِ لِكُميلٍ - : يا كُمَيلُ ، إنّهُ لا تَخلو مِن نِعمَةِ اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ عِندَكَ وعافِيَتِهِ ، فلا تَخْلُ مِن تَحميدِهِ وتَمجيدِهِ وتَسبيحِهِ وتَقديسِهِ وشُكرِهِ وذِكرِهِ على‏ كلِّ حالٍ
hadiths.english: 6163. Imam Ali (AS), in his advice to Kumayl said, 'O Kumayl, you cannot ever be devoid of the bounties of Allah and the good health [given to you by Him], so do not remain without praising Him, exalting Him, glorifying Him, sanctifying Him, thanking Him and remembering Him in every situation.'

hadiths.arabic: 6164. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : نِعمَتانِ مَفتونٌ فيهِما كَثيرٌ مِن النّاسِ : الفَراغُ والصِّحَّةُ
hadiths.english: 6164. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There are two bounties that most people are tested with: free time and health.'

hadiths.arabic: 6165. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : نِعمَتانِ مَكفورَتانِ : الأمنُ والعافِيَةُ
hadiths.english: 6165. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There are two bounties that people are ungrateful for: safety and good health.'

hadiths.arabic: 6166. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن كانَ في النِّعمَةِ جَهِلَ قَدرَ البَلِيَّةِ
hadiths.english: 6166. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who lives in bounties is ignorant of the worth of the calamity.'

hadiths.arabic: 6167. الإمامُ الحسنُ عليه السلام: تُجهَلُ النِّعَمُ ما أقامَت ، فإذا وَلَّت عُرِفَت
hadiths.english: 6167. Imam Hasan (AS) said, 'Bounties are ignored as long as they exist, but when they go they [their worth] are known.'

hadiths.arabic: 6168. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: أحسِنوا صُحبَةَ النِّعَمِ قَبلَ فِراقِها ؛ فإنّها تَزولُ وتَشهَدُ على‏ صاحِبِها بما عَمِلَ فيها
hadiths.english: 6168. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Appreciate the having of bounties before their departure, for they will leave and testify against their owner with respect to what he has done with them.'

hadiths.arabic: 6169. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِحذَروا نِفارَ النِّعَمِ ؛ فما كلُّ شارِدٍ بمَردُودٍ
hadiths.english: 6169. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Beware the fleeing of bounties, for not every runaway returns.'

hadiths.arabic: 6170. الإمامُ الهادي عليه السلام : ألقُوا النِّعَمَ بحُسنِ مُجاوَرَتِها ؛ والتَمِسوا الزِّيادَةَ فيها بالشُّكرِ علَيها ، واعلَموا أنّ النَّفسَ أقبَلُ شي‏ءٍ لِما اُعطِيَت ، وأمنَعُ شَي‏ءٍ لِما مُنِعَت
hadiths.english: 6170. Imam al-Hadi (AS) said, 'Meet bounties by embracing them, and plead for an increase in them by giving thanks for them, and know that the self is the most accepting of what it is given and the most resistant against that which it has been deprived of.'

sections.section_title_en: THAT WHICH CAUSES BOUNTIES TO REMAIN

hadiths.arabic: 6171. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ للَّهِ عِباداً اختَصَّهُم بالنِّعَمِ ، يُقِرُّها فيهِم ما بَذَلوها للنّاسِ ، فإذا مَنَعوها حَوَّلَها مِنهُم إلى‏ غَيرِهِم
hadiths.english: 6171. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Allah has servants whom He has chosen for bounties. He establishes these in them as long as they distribute them to people, but if they withhold them [the bounties], He transfers them to other people.'

hadiths.arabic: 6172. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن كَثُرَت نِعَمُ اللَّهِ علَيهِ كَثُرَت حَوائجُ النّاسِ إلَيهِ ، فمَن قامَ للَّهِ فيها بما يَجِبُ فيها عَرَّضَها لِلدَّوامِ والبَقاءِ ، ومَن لَم يَقُمْ فيها بما يَجِبُ عَرَّضَها لِلزَّوالِ والفَناءِ
hadiths.english: 6172. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He upon whom the bounties of Allah are plenty, people's needs from him increase accordingly. So, if he uses them for Allah in the way he must do so, He causes them to continue and remain. But if he does not use them in the way that he must, He will make them cease and perish.'

hadiths.arabic: 6173. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أقلُّ ما يَلزَمُكُم للَّهِ ألّا تَستَعينوا بنِعَمهِ على‏ مَعاصيهِ
hadiths.english: 6173. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The least of what you are obliged to do for Allah is to not use His bounties to commit acts of disobedience to Him.'

hadiths.arabic: 6174. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لا تَدومُ النِّعَمُ إلّا بعدَ ثَلاثٍ (إلّا بثَلاثٍ) : مَعرِفَةٌ بما يَلزَمُ للَّهِ سبحانَهُ فيها ، وأداءُ شُكرِها ، والتَّعَبُ فيها
hadiths.english: 6174. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Bounties only remain when accompanied by three things: knowledge of the status of Allah in the blessings [being from Him], fulfilment of thanks for them, and striving with them.'

hadiths.arabic: 6175. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن عَظُمَت نِعمَةُ اللَّهِ علَيهِ اشتَدَّت مَؤونَةُ النّاسِ علَيهِ ، فاستَديموا النِّعمَةَ باحتِمالِ المَؤونَةِ ولا تُعَرِّضوها لِلزَّوالِ ، فقَلَّ مَن زالَتَ عَنهُ النِّعمَةُ فكادَت أن تَعودَ إلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 6175. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'He upon whom are great bounties from Allah, people's needs from him increase accordingly. So, seek continuity in your bounties through bearing the expenses [of people], and do not let them cease, for it is seldom that one's bounties cease and return to him again.'

hadiths.arabic: 6176. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : مَنِ اقتَصَدَ وقَنَعَ بَقِيَت علَيهِ النِّعمَةُ، ومَن‏بَذَّرَ وأسرَفَ زالَت عنهُ‏النِّعمَةُ
hadiths.english: 6176. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'He who economizes and is content, his bounties will stay, and he who wastes and squanders, his bounties cease to remain with him.'

hadiths.arabic: 6177. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : اِستِعمالُ العَدلِ والإحسانِ مُؤْذِنٌ بِدَوامِ النِّعمَةِ
hadiths.english: 6177. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'Observing justice and benevolence invites the continuation of bounties.'

sections.section_title_en: CONSECUTIVE SUCCESSION OF BOUNTIES AND GRADUAL BAITING [FOR CHASTISEMENT]

hadiths.arabic: 6178. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يابنَ آدمَ ، إذا رَأيتَ ربَّكَ سبحانَهُ يُتابِعُ علَيكَ نِعمَهُ وأنتَ تَعصيهِ فاحذَرْهُ
hadiths.english: 6178. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'O son of Adam, if you see your Lord, glory be to Him, bestowing bounties upon you in continuous succession while you are disobeying Him, then be cautious of Him.'

hadiths.arabic: 6179. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أيُّها النّاسُ، لِيَرَكُمُ اللَّهُ مِن النِّعمَةِ وَجِلِينَ كما يَراكُم مِن النِّقمَةِ فَرِقِينَ ؛ إنّهُ مَن وُسِّعَ علَيهِ في ذاتِ يَدِهِ فلَم يَرَ ذلكَ استِدراجاً فَقد أمِنَ مَخُوفاً ، ومَن ضُيِّقَ علَيهِ في ذاتِ يَدِهِ فلَم يَرَ ذلكَ اختِباراً فَقد ضَيَّعَ مَأمولاً
hadiths.english: 6179. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'O people, let Allah see you fearing Him at the time of happiness just as you fear Him in time of distress. Certainly he who is given ease [of life] and does not consider it as a means of gradual baiting towards tribulation [wrongdoing], considers himself safe against what is to be feared, while he who is afflicted with straitened circumstances but does not perceive them to be a trial loses the coveted reward.'

hadiths.arabic: 6180. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : رُبَّ مُنعَمٍ علَيهِ مُستَدرَجٌ بالنُّعمى‏ ، ورُبَّ مُبتَلىً مَصنوعٌ لَهُ بالبَلوى‏
hadiths.english: 6180. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Very often a favoured person is gradually being driven [towards punishment] through these favours; and very often an afflicted person is being done good through his affliction.'

hadiths.arabic: 6181. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : الاستِدراجُ مِن اللَّهِ سبحانَهُ لِعَبدِهِ أن يُسبِغَ علَيهِ النِّعَمَ ويَسلُبَهُ الشُّكرَ
hadiths.english: 6181. Imam Husayn (AS) said, 'Allah Almighty's gradual baiting of His servant is that He envelops him with bounties and eradicates thankfulness from him.'

sections.section_title_en: PROCLAIMING ABOUT THE BOUNTIES OF ALLAH

hadiths.arabic: 6182. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ أن يَرى‏ أثَرَ نِعمَتِهِ على‏ عَبدِهِ
hadiths.english: 6182. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Allah loves to see the signs of His bounties on His servant.'

hadiths.arabic: 6183. أبو الأحوَصِ عن أبيهِ : دخلتُ على رسولِ اللَّه صلى اللَّه عليه وآله فرآني سيّئ الهيئة ، فقال النبيّ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله هل لك من شي‏ء ؟ قال : نعم من كلّ المال قد أتاني اللَّه فقال : إذا كان لك مالٌ فليُرى‏ عليك
hadiths.english: 6183. Abu al-Ahwas, narrating from his father said, 'I visited the Prophet (SAWA) and he saw me with a bad appearance, so the Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do you own anything?' I said, 'Yes, all the wealth that Allah has given me.' He (SAWA) said, 'If you have wealth then it should be seen on you.'

hadiths.arabic: 6184. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: إنّ اللَّهَ جَميلٌ يُحِبُّ الجَمالَ، ويُحِبُّ أن يَرى‏ أثَرَ النِّعمَةِ على‏ عَبدِهِ
hadiths.english: 6184. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Allah is Beautiful and He loves beauty, and He loves to see the sign of His bounties on His servant.'

hadiths.arabic: 6185. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إذا أنعَمَ اللَّهُ على‏ عَبدِهِ بنِعمَةٍ فظَهَرَت علَيهِ سُمِّيَ حَبيبَ اللَّهِ مُحَدِّثاً بنِعمَةِ اللَّهِ ، وإذا أنعَمَ اللَّهُ على‏ عَبدٍ بِنِعمَةٍ فلَم تَظهَرْ علَيهِ سُمِّيَ بَغيضَ اللَّهِ مُكَذِّباً بنِعمَةِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 6185. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'When Allah blesses His servant with bounties and it is manifest about him, he is called the beloved of Allah and a proclaimer of Allah's bounties, and when Allah blesses a servant with bounties and he does not show it, he is called the despiser of Allah and a denier of Allah's bounties.'

hadiths.arabic: 6186. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّي لَأكرَهُ لِلرّجُلِ أن يَكونَ علَيهِ نِعمَةٌ مِن اللَّهِ فلا يُظهِرُها
hadiths.english: 6186. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Indeed I hate for a man to have been bestowed bounties by Allah and to not show it.'

hadiths.arabic: 6187. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أمسى‏ وأصبحَ وعِندَهُ ثَلاثٌ فقد تَمَّت علَيهِ النِّعمَةُ في الدُّنيا : مَن أصبَحَ وأمسى‏ مُعافىً في بَدَنِهِ ، آمِناً في سَرْبِهِ ، عِندَهُ قُوتُ يَومِهِ ، فإن كانَت عِندَهُ الرّابِعَةُ فَقد تَمَّت علَيهِ النِّعمَةُ في الدُّنيا والآخِرَةِ ؛ وهُو الإيمانُ
hadiths.english: 6187. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever sleeps and wakes up possessing three things, then bounties for him in this world are complete: he who sleeps and wakes up with a healthy body, safe in his den, with enough sustenance for the day. And if he has a fourth thing then the bounties of this world and the Hereafter are complete in him, and that is faith.'

hadiths.arabic: 6188. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : بالتَّواضُعِ تَتِمُّ النِّعمَةُ
hadiths.english: 6188. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Bounties are completed through humbleness.'

hadiths.arabic: 6189. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : استَتِمُّوا نِعمَ اللَّهِ علَيكُم بالصَّبرِ على‏ طاعَتِهِ ، والمُجانَبَةِ لِمَعصيَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 6189. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Complete the bounties of Allah over you by having patience in obeying Him, and refraining from disobeying Him.'

hadiths.arabic: 6190. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : النَّعيمُ في الدُّنيا الأمنُ وصِحَّةُ الجِسمِ ، وتَمامُ النِّعمَةِ في الآخِرَةِ دُخولُ الجَنَّةِ ، وما تَمَّتِ النِّعمَةُ على‏ عَبدٍ قَطُّ لَم يَدخُلِ الجَنَّةَ
hadiths.english: 6190. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Bounties in this world are safety and a healthy body, and the completion of bounties in the Hereafter is entrance into Heaven. And the bounties [of Allah] are not complete until the servant enters Heaven.'

sections.section_title_en: THE CARNAL SOUL THAT PROMPTS TO EVIL

hadiths.arabic: 6191. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : النَّفسُ الأمّارةُ المُسَوِّلَةُ تَتَملَّقُ تَمَلُّقَ المُنافِقِ ، وتَتَصَنَّعُ بشِيمَةِ الصَّديقِ المُوافِق ، حتّى‏ إذا خَدَعَت وتَمَكَّنَت تسَلَّطَت تَسَلُّطَ العَدُوِّ ، وتَحَكَّمَت تَحَكُّمَ العُتُوِّ ، فأورَدَت مَوارِدَ السُّوءِ
hadiths.english: 6191. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The carnal, seducting soul flatters as a hypocrite flatters, and simulates the characteristics of an agreeing friend, and as soon as it tricks and overcomes him [man], itoverpowers him as an enemy overpowers and controls him like a controlling tyrant, and hence it [the soul] drives a man towards his ruin.'

hadiths.arabic: 6192. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام - في المُناجاةِ - : إلهي ، إليكَ أشكو نَفساً بالسُّوءِ أمّارَةً ، وإلَى الخَطيئةِ مُبادِرَةً ، وبمَعاصيكَ مُولَعَةً ، كثيرَةَ العِلَلِ ، طَويلَةَ الأمَلِ ، إن مَسَّها الشَّرُّ تَجزَعْ ، وإن مَسَّها الخَيرُ تَمنَعْ ، مَيّالَةً إلَى اللَّعبِ واللَّهوِ ، مَملُوّةً بالغَفلَةِ والسَّهوِ ، تُسرِعُ بي إلَى الحَوبَةِ ، وتُسَوِّفُني بالتَّوبَةِ
hadiths.english: 6192. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS), in an intimate supplication said, 'O Allah, to You I complain of a soul that prompts to evil, that hastens towards wrongdoing and is fond of disobeying You... it has many faults, yet [entertains] high expectations; when evil strikes it, it worries, and when good comes its way, it withholds it. It inclines to amusement and frivolity, full of inattentiveness and forgetfulness; it hastens me to sin, and stalls me from repentance.'

hadiths.arabic: 6193. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله في وصيَّتهِ لابنِ مَسعودٍ - : يابنَ مَسعودٍ ، أكثِرْ مِن الصّالِحاتِ والبِرِّ ؛ فإنّ المُحسِنَ والمُسِي‏ءَ يَندَمانِ ، يَقولُ المُحسِنُ : يا لَيتَني ازدَدتُ مِن الحَسَناتِ ! ويقولُ المُسِي‏ءُ : قَصَّرتُ ، وتَصديقُ ذلكَ قَولُهُ تعالى‏ : (ولا اُقْسِمُ بالنَّفْسِ اللَّوّامَةِ)
hadiths.english: 6193. The Prophet (SAWA), in his advice to Ibn Masud said, 'O Ibn Masud, increase in the acts of righteousness and good, for both the good [people] and the bad will regret; the good-doer will say, 'If only I had done more good!' And the bad-doer will say, 'I was negligent', and the evidence for this is the verse:“And I swear by the self-blaming soul!”

sections.section_title_en: TEACHING THE SOUL, DISCIPLINING IT AND PURIFYING IT

hadiths.arabic: 6194. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أيُّها النّاسُ ، تَولّوا مِن أنفسِكُم تأديبَها ، واعدِلوا بِها عَن ضَراوَةِ عاداتِها
hadiths.english: 6194. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'O people, take charge of the disciplining of your selves, and redress them from the wildness of their habits.'

hadiths.arabic: 6195. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: اِملِكوا أنفُسَكُم بدَوامِ جِهادِها
hadiths.english: 6195. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Rule your souls by continuously struggling with them.'

hadiths.arabic: 6196. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنَّ تَقوَى اللَّهِ دَواءُ داءِ قُلوبِكُم... وطَهورُ دَنَسِ أنفُسِكُم
hadiths.english: 6196. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Godwariness is the cure for the sickness of your hearts....and the purification of the pollution of your souls.'

hadiths.arabic: 6197. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أقبِلْ على‏ نَفسِكَ بالإدبارِ عَنها
hadiths.english: 6197. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Come closer to your soul by retracting from it [i.e. its carnal desires].'

hadiths.arabic: 6198. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن ذَمَّ نفسَهُ أصلَحَها ، مَن مَدَحَ نَفسَهُ ذَبَحَها
hadiths.english: 6198. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who censures his soul improves it, and he who praises his soul slaughters it.'

hadiths.arabic: 6199. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن لَم يُهَذِّبْ نفسَهُ فضَحَهُ سُوءُ العادَةِ
hadiths.english: 6199. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who does not refine his soul will be disgraced by bad habits.'

hadiths.arabic: 6200. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن لَم يَتَعاهَدِ النَّقصَ مِن نفسِهِ غَلَبَ علَيهِ الهَوى‏ ، ومَن كانَ في نَقصٍ فالمَوتُ خَيرٌ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 6200. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who does not engage himself in remedying the defects in his soul, its whims will overcome him, and he who [lives] in deficiency, then death is surely better for him.'

sections.section_title_en: THE EFFECTS OF A NOBLE SOUL

hadiths.arabic: 6201. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن كَرُمَت علَيهِ نَفسُهُ لَم يُهِنْها بالمَعصيَةِ
hadiths.english: 6201. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who honours his soul will not humiliate it with sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 6202. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن كَرُمَت علَيهِ نَفسُهُ هانَت علَيهِ شَهوَتُهُ
hadiths.english: 6202. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who honours his soul, his desires become insignificant for him.'

hadiths.arabic: 6203. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن كَرُمَت نَفسُهُ صَغُرَتِ الدُّنيا في عَينِهِ
hadiths.english: 6203. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who honours his soul, the world becomes small in his eyes.'

hadiths.arabic: 6204. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ النِّفاقَ يَبدو لُمظَةً سَوداءَ ، فكُلّما ازدادَ النِّفاقُ عِظَماً ازدادَ ذلكَ السَّوادُ ، فإذا استَكمَلَ النِّفاقُ اسوَدَّ القَلبُ
hadiths.english: 6204. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Hypocrisy appears as a black dot [on the heart]. Whenever hypocrisy increases in magnitude that black dot increases, and when hypocrisy becomes complete the heart becomes black.'

hadiths.arabic: 6205. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : النِّفاقُ أخو الشِّركِ
hadiths.english: 6205. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Hypocrisy is the brother of polytheism.'

hadiths.arabic: 6206. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما أقبَحَ بالإنسانِ‏ظاهِراً مُوافِقاً، وباطِناً مُنافِقاً !
hadiths.english: 6206. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'How hideous is the human being whose outer is agreeable while his inner is hypocritical.'

hadiths.arabic: 6207. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : نِفاقُ المَرءِ مِن ذُلٍّ يَجِدُهُ في نفسِهِ
hadiths.english: 6207. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The hypocrisy of a person [stems] from the inferiority he finds within himself.'

hadiths.arabic: 6208. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : المُنافِقُ مَن إذا وَعَدَ أخلَفَ ، وإذا فَعَلَ أفشى‏ ، وإذا قالَ كَذَبَ ، وإذا ائتُمِنَ خانَ ، وإذا رُزِقَ طاشَ ، وإذا مُنِعَ عاشَ
hadiths.english: 6208. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A hypocrite is someone who when he makes a promise he does not fulfil it, when he does something [good], he shows off, when he speaks he lies, when he is entrusted with something he betrays, when he is given sustenance he is heedless, and when he is deprived he resorts to tricks.'

hadiths.arabic: 6209. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : المُنافِقُ يَملِكُ عَينَيهِ يَبكي كما يَشاءُ
hadiths.english: 6209. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A hypocrite has control over his eyes, he cries whenever he wants to.'

hadiths.arabic: 6210. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لِلمُنافِقينَ عَلاماتٌ يُعرَفونَ بِها : تَحِيَّتُهُم لَعنَةٌ ، وطَعامُهُم نُهمَةٌ ، وغَنيمَتُهُم غُلولٌ ، لا يَقرَبونَ المَساجِدَ إلّا هُجراً ، ولا يَأتونَ الصَّلاةَ إلّا دُبُراً ، مُستَكبِرينَ لا يَألَفونَ ولا يُؤلَفونَ ، خُشُبٌ باللَّيلِ سُخُبٌ بالنَّهارِ
hadiths.english: 6210. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Hypocrites have signs through which they are known: their greeting is cursing, their food is greed [gluttony], their earnings are through breaches of trust, they do not come close to the mosques save with contempt, they fulfil their prayers at the very last moment, [they are] haughty people who do not socialize and are not sociable, they are as wood in the night, loud in the day.'

hadiths.arabic: 6211. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن خالَفَت سَريرَتُهُ عَلانِيَتَهُ فهُو مُنافِقٌ كائناً مَن كانَ
hadiths.english: 6211. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He whose inner is contrary to his outer is a hypocrite, no matter who he may be.'

hadiths.arabic: 6212. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما زادَ خُشوعُ الجَسَدِ على‏ ما في القَلبِ فهُو عِندَنا نِفاقٌ
hadiths.english: 6212. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When humbleness of the body supercedes that which is in the heart then in our view it is hypocrisy.'

hadiths.arabic: 6213. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : المُنافِقُ إذا نَظَرَ لَها ، وإذا سَكَتَ سَها ، وإذا تَكَلَّمَ لَغا ، وإذا استَغنى‏ طَغا ، وإذا أصابَتهُ شِدَّةٌ ضَغا ، فهُو قَريبُ السُّخطِ بَعيدُ الرِّضا ، يُسخِطُهُ علَى اللَّهِ اليَسيرُ ، ولا يُرضيهِ الكثيرُ ، يَنوي كثيراً مِن الشَّرِّ ويَعمَلُ بطائفَةٍ مِنهُ ، ويَتَلَهَّفُ على‏ ما فاتَهُ مِن الشَّرِّ كيفَ لَم يَعمَلْ بهِ !
hadiths.english: 6213. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'A hypocrite, when he looks he is frivolous, when he is silent he forgets, when he speaks he prattles, when he becomes wealthy he tyrannizes, when hardship afflicts him he becomes noisy, so he is close to discontentment and far from contentment. The least of things make him discontented with Allah, and he is never content, even with much. He intends to do a lot of evil and commits some of them, and he regrets the evil deeds that pass him by and how he did not manage to commit them.'

hadiths.arabic: 6214. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لو ضَرَبتُ خَيشومَ المُؤمِنِ بسَيفي هذا على‏ أن يُبغِضَني ما أبغَضَني ، ولو صَبَبتُ الدُّنيا بِجَمّاتِها علَى المُنافِقِ على‏ أن يُحِبَّني ما أحَبَّني ، وذلكَ أنّهُ قُضِيَ فانقَضى‏ على‏ لِسانِ النَّبيِّ الاُمِّيِّ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله، أنّهُ قالَ : يا عليُّ، لا يُبغِضُكَ مُؤمِنٌ ، ولا يُحِبُّكَ مُنافِقٌ
hadiths.english: 6214. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'If I was to strike the nose of a believer with my sword to hate me he would never hate me, and if I was to pour down the whole world onto a hypocrite to love me he would never love me, and this is because of what has been destined, as this was passed on through the tongue of the unschooled Prophet (SAWA), saying, 'Ali, a believer can never hate you and a hypocrite can never love you.'

hadiths.arabic: 6215. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : المُنافِقُ يَنهى‏ ولا يَنتَهي ، ويأمُرُ بما لا يأتي ، إذا قامَ في الصَّلاةِ اعتَرَضَ ، وإذا رَكَعَ رَبَضَ ، وإذا سَجَدَ نَقَرَ ، وإذا جَلَسَ شَغَرَ ، يُمسي وهَمُّهُ الطَّعامُ وهُو مُفطِرٌ ، ويُصبِحُ وهَمُّهُ النَّومُ ولَم يَسهَرْ ، إن حَدَّثَكَ كَذبَكَ ، وإن وَعَدَكَ أخلَفَكَ ، وإنِ ائتَمَنتَهُ خانَكَ ، وإن خالَفتَهُ اغتابَكَ
hadiths.english: 6215. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'A hypocrite prohibits [wrongdoing] but does not refrain from it himself, and he enjoins that which he does not do himself. When he prays he complains, when he bows (ruku) he slumps, when he prostrates (sujud) he pecks [prostrating so fast], when he sits he spreads himself out, when he is going to bed his only concern is food even though he is full, and when he wakes up in the morning, his only concern is sleep even though he did not stay up during the night. When he speaks to you he lies, when he makes a promise he does not fulfil it, if you entrust him with anything he betrays it, and if you disagree with him he backbites you.'

hadiths.arabic: 6216. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : أربَعٌ مِن عَلاماتِ النِّفاقِ : قَساوَةُ القَلبِ ، وجُمودُ العَينِ ، والإصرارُ علَى الذَّنبِ ، والحِرصُ علَى الدُّنيا
hadiths.english: 6216. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'There are four signs to a hypocrite: hardheartedness, dryness of the eyes, persistence in sinning, and greed for the world.'

hadiths.arabic: 6217. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أظهَرُ النّاسِ نِفاقاً مَن أمَرَ بالطّاعَةِ ولَم يَعمَلْ بها، ونَهى‏ عنِ المَعصيَةِ ولَم يَنتَهِ عنها
hadiths.english: 6217. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The most obvious of hypocrites is he who enjoins acts of obedience but does not perform them himself, and prohibits wrongdoing but does not refrain from them himself.'

hadiths.arabic: 6218. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أشَدُّ النّاسِ نِفاقاً مَن أمَرَ بالطّاعَةِ ولَم يَعمَلْ بها ، ونَهى‏ عَنِ المَعصيَةِ ولم يَنتَهِ عنها
hadiths.english: 6218. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The most severe of hypocrites is he who enjoins acts of obedience, but does not perform them himself, and prohibits wrongdoing but does not refrain from them himself.'

hadiths.arabic: 6219. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ولَقد قالَ لي رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّي لا أخافُ على‏ اُمَّتي مُؤمِناً ولا مُشرِكاً ، أمّا المُؤمنُ فيَمنَعُهُ اللَّهُ بإيمانِهِ ، وأمّا المُشرِكُ فيَقمَعُهُ اللَّهُ بشِركِهِ، ولكنّي أخافُ علَيكُم كُلَّ مُنافِقِ الجَنانِ ، عالِمِ اللِّسانِ ، يقولُ ما تَعرِفونَ ، ويَفعَلُ ما تُنكِرونَ
hadiths.english: 6219. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Verily, the Prophet (SAWA) said to me, 'With respect to my people, I am afraid neither of a believer nor of an unbeliever. As for the believer, Allah will afford him protection because of his belief and as for the disbeliever, Allah will humiliate him because of his disbelief. But I am afraid about every one from among you who is a hypocrite in his heart and eloquent of speech. He speaks what you hold to be good but does what you dislike.'

sections.section_title_en: THE DESCRIPTION OF THE RESURRECTION OF HYPOCRITES AND THEIR END

hadiths.arabic: 6220. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يَجي‏ءُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ ذو الوَجهَينِ دالِعاً لِسانَهُ في قَفاهُ ، وآخَرُ مِن قُدّامِهِ ، يَلتَهِبانِ ناراً حتّى‏ يُلهِبا جَسَدَهُ ، ثُمّ يُقالُ لَهُ : هذا الّذي كانَ في الدُّنيا ذا وَجهَينِ وذا لِسانَينِ ، يُعرَفُ بذلكَ يَومَ القِيامَةِ
hadiths.english: 6220. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He [the hypocrite] will come on the Day of Judgment with two faces and with his tongue hanging out from the back of his head, and with another tongue hanging in front. They will both be ignited with fire until they ignite his body, then it will be said about him: This is the one who was two-faced and two-tongued in the world, and he will be known as such on the Day of Resurrection.'

hadiths.arabic: 6221. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ذو الوَجهَينِ في الدُّنيا يأتي يَومَ القِيامَةِ ولَهُ وَجهانِ مِن نارٍ
hadiths.english: 6221. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A two-faced person in this world will come on the Day of Resurrection with two faces of fire.'

hadiths.arabic: 6222. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الصَّلاةُ علَيَّ وعلى‏ أهلِ بَيتي تَذهَبُ بالنِّفاقِ
hadiths.english: 6222. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Invoking blessings on me and my household takes away hypocrisy.'

hadiths.arabic: 6223. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ارفَعوا أصواتَكُم بالصَّلاةِ علَيَّ ؛ فإنّها تَذهَبُ بالنِّفاقِ
hadiths.english: 6223. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Raise your voices in invocation of blessings on me for it takes away hypocrisy.'

hadiths.arabic: 6224. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أرضُ القِيامَةِ نارٌ ما خَلا ظِلَّ المُؤمِنِ ؛ فإنَّ صَدَقَتَهُ تُظِلُّهُ
hadiths.english: 6224. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The ground on the Day of Judgment will be fire except for the shadow of the believer, for his charity will shade him.'

hadiths.arabic: 6225. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أعطى‏ دِرهَماً في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ كَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَهُ سبعَمِائةِ حَسَنَةٍ
hadiths.english: 6225. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever gives a dirham in the path of Allah, Allah will write for him five hundred merits.'

hadiths.arabic: 6226. الترغيب والترهيب : - قال رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله لأصحابِهِ - : أيُّكُم مالُ وارِثهِ أحَبُّ إلَيهِ مِن مالِهِ ؟ قالوا : يا رسولَ اللَّهِ ، ما مِنّا أحدٌ إلّا مالُهُ أحَبُّ إلَيهِ مِن مالِ وارِثِهِ. قالَ : فإنَّ مالَهُ ما قَدَّمَ ، ومالَ وارِثِهِ ما أخَّرَ
hadiths.english: 6226. The Prophet (SAWA) said to his companions, 'Which of you loves the money of his heirs more than his own money?' They said, 'O Messenger of Allah, we all love our own money more than the money of our heirs.' He said, 'One's own money is that which is put forward and the money of one's heir [i.e. that which we save and not spend in charity] is that which he leaves behind.'

hadiths.arabic: 6227. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : طُوبى‏ لِمَن أنفَقَ الفَضلَ مِن مالِهِ وأمسَكَ الفَضلَ مِن كلامِهِ
hadiths.english: 6227. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Blessings be upon he who spends the excess of his money and guards the excess of his speech.'

hadiths.arabic: 6228. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّكُم أغبَطُ بما بَذَلتُم مِن الرّاغِبِ إلَيكُم فيما وَصَلَهُ مِنكُم
hadiths.english: 6228. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'You will be more overjoyed for what you have given away than the one who asked you for what you have given him.'

hadiths.arabic: 6229. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في وصيَّتِهِ لابنهِ الحسنِ عليه السلام - : إنّما لكَ مِن دُنياكَ ما أصلَحتَ بهِ مَثواكَ ، فأنفِقْ في حَقٍّ ولا تَكُن خازِناً لِغَيرِكَ
hadiths.english: 6229. Imam Ali (AS), in his will to his son al-Hasan (AS) said, 'You have in your world that with which you can reform your [eternal] abode, so spend rightfully and do not be a storage place for others ['s dues].'

hadiths.arabic: 6230. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّكُم إلى‏ إنفاقِ ما اكتَسَبتُم أحوَجُ مِنكُم إلَى اكتِسابِ ما تَجمَعونَ
hadiths.english: 6230. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Indeed you are more in need of spending in charity what you have earned than gaining what you accumulate.

hadiths.arabic: 6231. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَلعونٌ مَلعونٌ مَن وَهَبَ اللَّهُ لَه مالاً فلَم يَتَصَدَّقْ مِنهُ بشي‏ءٍ
hadiths.english: 6231. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Cursed! Cursed is he whom Allah has endowed with wealth and he does not donate any of it.'

sections.section_title_en: THE BLESSING OF SPENDING IN HIS WAY

hadiths.arabic: 6232. مكارم‏الأخلاق عن رجلٍ من أصحابِ الإمامِ الصّادقِ عليه السلام : قلتُ لأبي عبدِ اللَّه عليه السلام : قولُهُ تعالى‏ : (وما أنفَقْتُم من شي‏ء فهو يخلفه ...) فَأراني اُنفِقُ ولا أرى‏ خَلَفاً! قالَ : أفَتَرَى اللَّهَ أخلَفَ وَعدَهُ ؟! قلتُ : لا ، قالَ : فمِمَّ ؟ قُلتُ : لا أدري ، قالَ : لَو أنّ أحَدَكُمُ اكتَسَبَ المالَ مِن حِلِّهِ وأنفَقَهُ في حَقِّهِ لَم يُنفِقْ دِرهَماً إلّا أخلَفَ اللَّهُ علَيهِ
hadiths.english: 6232. Makarim al-Akhlaq, narrating from one of the companions of Imam al-Sadiq (AS) who said: 'I told Imam al-Sadiq (AS), 'based on Allah's saying:“whatever you may spend...” , I donate but do not see any repayment.' He (AS) asked: 'Have you ever seen Allah not fulfil His promise?' I said, 'No.' He asked, 'Then why do you say this?' I said, 'I do not know.' He said, 'If any of you acquires legitimate wealth and spends it rightfully, then he will not spend a single dirham without Allah repaying it.'

hadiths.arabic: 6233. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما نَقَصَ مالٌ مِن صَدَقَةٍ قَطُّ ، فأعطُوا ولا تَجبُنوا
hadiths.english: 6233. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Absolutely no wealth will ever decrease as a result of charity, so give and do not be afraid.'

hadiths.arabic: 6234. عائشة : أنّهُم ذَبَحوا شاةً ، فقالَ النَّبيُّ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: ما بَقِيَ ؟ فقالَت : ما بَقِيَ مِنها إلّا كَتِفُها ، قالَ [ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله ]: بَقِيَ كلُّها غيرَ كَتِفِها
hadiths.english: 6234. A?isha said, 'They slaughtered a sheep [to distribute its meat]'. The Prophet (SAWA) asked, 'Is there any of it remaining?' She said, 'Nothing remains other than its shoulder.' He (SAWA) said, 'All of it remains [forever] other than its shoulder.'

hadiths.arabic: 6235. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن أيقَنَ بالخَلَفِ جادَ بالعَطيَّةِ
hadiths.english: 6235. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who is certain of the repayment is generous with giving.'

hadiths.arabic: 6236. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: أنفِقْ وأيقِنْ بالخَلَفِ
hadiths.english: 6236. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Spend and be certain of being repaid.'

hadiths.arabic: 6237. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: إنّ الصَّدَقَةَ تَقضي الدَّينَ وتَخلُفُ بالبَركَةِ
hadiths.english: 6237. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Charity fulfils the repayment of debts and brings about blessings.'

sections.section_title_en: SPENDING OUT OF WHAT YOU LOVE

hadiths.arabic: 6238. أبو الطُّفَيلِ : اشتَرى‏ عليٌّ عليه السلام ثَوباً فأعجَبَهُ فتَصَدَّقَ بهِ
hadiths.english: 6238. Abu al-Tufayl said, 'Ali (AS) bought a piece of clothing and liked it, so he gave it away in charity.'

hadiths.arabic: 6239. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - وقد قيل له ، وكانَ يَتَصَدَّقُ بالسُّكَّرِ - : أتَتَصَدَّقُ بالسُّكّرِ؟! : نَعَم، إنّهُ لَيس شَي‏ءٌ أحَبَّ إلَيَّ مِنهُ ، فأنا اُحِبُّ أن أتَصَدَّقَ بأحَبِّ الأشياءِ إلَيَّ
hadiths.english: 6239. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), when someone saw him donating sugar, and asked him 'Do you give sugar as charity?', replied, 'Yes, there is nothing I love more than it, and I love to donate the thing that I love the most.'

sections.section_title_ar: مَن لَم يُنفِق في طاعَةِ اللَّهِ يُنفِق في مَعصِيَتِهِ‏
sections.section_title_en: HE WHO DOES NOT SPEND IN OBEDIENCE OF ALLAH SPENDS IN HIS DISOBEDIENCE

hadiths.arabic: 6240. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن مَنَعَ مالَهُ مِن الأخيارِ اختِياراً صَرَفَ اللَّهُ مالَهُ إلَى الأشرارِ اضطِراراً
hadiths.english: 6240. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever withholds his wealth from the righteous discriminatingly, Allah will forcefully distribute his wealth to the evil.'

hadiths.arabic: 6241. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : ما مِن عَبدٍ يَمنَعُ دِرهَماً في حَقِّهِ إلّا أنفَقَ اثنَينِ في غَيرِ حَقِّهِ
hadiths.english: 6241. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'No sooner does a servant withhold the spending of a dirham in its rightful place than he will end up spending two dirhams outside of its rightful place.'

hadiths.arabic: 6242. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إيّاكَ أن تَمنَعَ في طاعَةِ اللَّهِ ، فتُنفِقَ مِثلَيهِ في مَعصيَةِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 6242. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Beware of withholding [charity] in the obedience of Allah, for you will spend twice its amount in disobeying Him.'

sections.section_title_en: THE VIRTUE OF THE CHARITY GIVEN BY ONE WHO IS HIMSELF STRAITENED

hadiths.arabic: 6243. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: ثَلاثَةٌ مِن حَقائقِ الإيمانِ: الإنفاقُ مِن الإقتارِ ، وإنصافُكَ النّاسَ مِن نَفسِكَ ، وبَذلُ العِلمِ لِلمُتَعلِّمِ
hadiths.english: 6243. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There are three things that constitute the realities of faith: the charity given by a person who is himself straitened, your fairness towards people in spite of yourself, and spreading knowledge to those who seek it.'

hadiths.arabic: 6244. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : إنّ مِن أخلاقِ المُؤمنِ الإنفاقَ على‏ قَدرِ الإقتارِ
hadiths.english: 6244. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'Among the moral virtues of a believer is spending [in charity] according to his financial condition.'

sections.section_title_en: THOSE WHOSE SPENDING [IN CHARITY] IS NOT ACCEPTED

hadiths.arabic: 6245. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عن قولهِ تعالى‏ : (ولا تَيَمَّمُوا الخَبيثَ مِنْهُ تُنْفِقونَ) - : كانَ النّاسُ حينَ أسلَموا عِندَهُم مَكاسِبُ مِن الرِّبا ومِن أموالٍ خَبيثَةٍ ، فكانَ الرّجُلُ يَتعَمَّدُها مِن بَينِ مالِهِ فتَصَدّقَ بها ، فنهاهُمُ اللَّهُ عَن ذلكَ، وإنّ الصَّدَقَةَ لا تَصلُحُ إلّا مِن كَسبٍ طَيِّبٍ
hadiths.english: 6245. Imam al-Baqir (AS), when he was asked about Allah's verse in the Qur'an:“and do not be of the mind to give the bad part of it” , said, 'When people became Muslims, they had earnings from usury and from unlawful dealings, and a man would mix it in with his money and donate from it. So, Allah prohibited them from doing so, and charity is only correct [when given] out of pure earnings.'

hadiths.arabic: 6246. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لَو أنَّ النّاسَ أخَذوا ما أمَرَهُمُ اللَّهُ بهِ فأنفَقوهُ فيما نَهاهُم عَنهُ ما قَبِلَهُ مِنهُم ، ولو أخَذوا ما نَهاهُمُ اللَّهُ عَنهُ فأنفَقوهُ فيما أمَرَهُمُ اللَّهُ بهِ ما قَبِلَهُ مِنهُم ؛ حتّى‏ يأخُذوهُ مِن حَقٍّ ويُنفِقوهُ في حَقٍّ
hadiths.english: 6246. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'If people were to earn whence Allah has ordered them to and spend it in that which He has forbidden, then He will not accept it from them. And if they earn what Allah has prohibited them from and spend it in that which He has ordered them to, He will not accept it from them either unless they take it from its rightful place and spend it in its rightful place.'

hadiths.arabic: 6247. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إيّاكُم والنَّميمَةَ
hadiths.english: 6247. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Beware of talebearing.'

hadiths.arabic: 6248. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : قالَ رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله لاٌصحابهِ: ألا اُخبِرُكُم بشِرارِكُم ؟ قالوا : بلى‏ يا رسولَ اللَّهِ قالَ : المَشّاؤونَ بالنَّميمَةِ ، المُفَرِّقونَ بَينَ الأحِبَّةِ ، الباغُونَ لِلبُرَآءِ العَيبَ
hadiths.english: 6248. Imam Ali (AS)) said, 'The Messenger of Allah (SAWA) said to his companions: 'Shall I inform you of the most evil from among you?' They said, 'Yes, O Messenger of Allah.' He conti-nued, 'The talebearers, those who break up loved ones, and those who seek faults in the righteous.'

hadiths.arabic: 6249. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إيّاكَ والنَّميمَةَ ؛ فإنّها تَزرَعُ الضَّغينَةَ وتُبَعِّدُ عنِ اللَّهِ والنّاسِ
hadiths.english: 6249. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Beware of talebearing, for it plants enmity and distances one from Allah and people.'

hadiths.arabic: 6250. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أسوَأُ الصِّدقِ النَّميمَةُ
hadiths.english: 6250. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The worst of truthfulness is talebearing.'

hadiths.arabic: 6251. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ مِن أكبَرِ السِّحرِ النَّميمَةَ ؛ يُفَرَّقُ بها بَينَ المُتَحابَّينِ ، ويُجلَبُ العَداوَةُ علَى المُتَصافِيَينِ ، ويُسفَكُ بها الدِّماءُ ، ويُهدَمُ بها الدُّورُ ، ويُكشَفُ بها السُّتورُ ، والنَّمّامُ أشَرُّ مَن وَطئَ علَى الأرضِ بقَدَمٍ
hadiths.english: 6251. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The greatest of sorcery is slandering, for through it loved ones are broken up, animosity is brought in between sincere friends, blood is shed, houses are demolished, veils are uncovered, and the talebearer is the most evil thing that has laid a step on this earth.'

hadiths.arabic: 6252. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن سَعى‏ بأخيهِ إلى‏ سُلطانٍ أحبَطَ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ عَمَلَهُ كُلَّهُ ، وإن وَصَلَ إلَيهِ مَكروهٌ أو أذىً جَعَلَهُ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ مَع هامانَ في درَجَةٍ في النّارِ
hadiths.english: 6252. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'He who informs against his brother to a ruler, Allah will destroy all of his deeds, and if the person he informed on is harmed or hurt, Allah Almighty will put the informant with Haman [Pharaoh's vizier] on the same level in the Hellfire.'

hadiths.arabic: 6253. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: السّاعي قاتِلُ ثَلاثَةٍ : قاتِلُ نَفسِهِ ، وقاتِلُ مَن يَسعى‏ بهِ ، وقاتِلُ مَن يَسعى‏ إلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 6253. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'An informant is a killer of three: killer of himself, killer of the person who he informed of, and killer of the person he is informing to.'

hadiths.arabic: 6254. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: إنّ لِلقُلوبِ إقبالاً وإدباراً ، فإذا أقبَلَت فتَنَفَّلوا ، وإذا أدبَرَت فعلَيكُم بالفَريضَةِ
hadiths.english: 6254. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Hearts have [the capacity to] incline [to worship] and to retract, so when they incline then perform the supererogatory, and when they retract then observe the obligatory.'

hadiths.arabic: 6255. الفُضَيل : سألتُ أبا جعفرٍ عليه السلام عن قَولِ اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ : (الّذينَ هُمْ على‏ صَلَواتِهِمْ يُحافِظونَ) قالَ : هِي الفَريضَةُ قلتُ : (الّذينَ هُمْ على‏ صَلاتِهِمْ دائِمونَ) قالَ : هِيَ النّافِلَةُ
hadiths.english: 6255. Al-Fudayl said, 'I asked Abu Jafar [al-Baqir] (AS) about Allah's verse in the Qur'an:“and those who are watchful of their prayers.” He said, 'These are the obligatory prayers.' I asked,“those who are persevering in their prayers.” ? He said, 'They are the supererogatory prayers.'

sections.section_title_en: PRECEDENCE OF THE OBLIGATORY PRAYERS OVER THE SUPEREROGATORY

hadiths.arabic: 6256. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا رُخصَةَ في فَرضٍ ، ولا شِدَّةَ في نافِلَةٍ
hadiths.english: 6256. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'There is no leniency with respect to the obligatory, and there is no hardship [imposed] with respect to the supererogatory.'

hadiths.arabic: 6257. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا أضَرَّتِ النَّوافِلُ بالفَرائضِ فارْفُضوها
hadiths.english: 6257. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'When the supererogatory prayers harm the obligatory ones then leave them.'

hadiths.arabic: 6258. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا قُربَةَ بالنَّوافِلِ إذا أضَرَّت بالفَرائضِ
hadiths.english: 6258. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'There is no proximity [to Allah] achieved with the supererogatory if they affect the obligatory [prayers] adversely.'

hadiths.arabic: 6259. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام - في الدّعاء - : وَهَبْ لي نُوراً أمشي بهِ في النّاسِ ، وأهتَدي بهِ في الظُّلُماتِ ، وأستَضي‏ءُ بهِ مِن الشَّكِّ والشُّبُهاتِ
hadiths.english: 6259. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS), in a supplication said, 'And grant me a light with which I can walk among people, and through which I can be guided in a manifold darkness, and with which I can enlighten myself from doubts and uncertainties.'

hadiths.arabic: 6260. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لَيسَ العِلمُ بالتَّعلُّمِ ، إنّما هُو نُورٌ يَقَعُ في قَلبِ مَن يُريدُ اللَّهُ تباركَ وتعالى‏ أن يَهدِيَهُ
hadiths.english: 6260. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Knowledge is not [achieved] through learning; rather it is a light that falls into the heart of one whom Allah Almighty wishes to guide.'

sections.section_title_en: THE LIGHT OF THE HEART AND THE LIGHT OF THE FACE

hadiths.arabic: 6261. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: أكثِرْ صَمتَكَ يَتَوفَّرْ فِكرُكَ ، ويَستَنِرْ قَلبُكَ ، ويَسلَمِ النّاسُ مِن يَدَيكَ
hadiths.english: 6261. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Increase your silence and your thoughts will flourish, your heart will enlighten, and people will be safe from your hands.'

hadiths.arabic: 6262. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عَن عِلَّةِ كَونِ المُتَهَجِّدينَ باللَّيلِ مِن أحسَنِ النّاسِ وَجهاً - : لأ نَّهُم خَلَوا باللَّهِ فكَساهُمُ اللَّهُ مِن نُورِهِ
hadiths.english: 6262. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS), when asked about the reason why those who perform the night prayer have the most beautiful faces among people, replied, 'Because they seclude themselves with Allah and so Allah covers them in His light.'

hadiths.arabic: 6263. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : طَلَبتُ نُورَ القَلبِ فوَجَدتُهُ في التَّفَكُّرِ والبُكاءِ ، وطَلَبتُ الجَوازَ علَى الصِّراطِ فوَجَدتُهُ في الصَّدَقَةِ ، وطَلَبتُ نُورَ الوَجهِ فوَجَدتُهُ في صَلاةِ اللَّيلِ
hadiths.english: 6263. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'I sought for light of the heart and found it in contemplation and crying. I sought for crossing the Bridge [on the Day of Resurrection] and found it in giving charity. I sought for light of the face and found it in the night prayer.'

sections.section_title_en: THERE IS A LIGHT FOR EVERYTHING GOOD

hadiths.arabic: 6264. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الصَّلاةُ نُورٌ
hadiths.english: 6264. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Prayer is light.'

hadiths.arabic: 6265. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن رَمى‏ بسَهمٍ في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ كانَ لَهُ نُوراً يَومَ القِيامَةِ
hadiths.english: 6265. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever strikes an arrow in the path of Allah will have a light on the Day of Judgment.'

hadiths.arabic: 6266. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : علَيكَ بتِلاوَةِ القرآنِ ؛ فإنّهُ نُورٌ لَكَ في الأرضِ ، وذُخرٌ لكَ في السّماءِ
hadiths.english: 6266. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do recite the Quran, for it is a light for you on the earth and a provision for you in Heaven.'

hadiths.arabic: 6267. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن شَهِدَ شَهادَةَ حَقٍّ لِيُحيِيَ بِها حَقَّ امرئٍ مُسلِمٍ أتى‏ يَومَ القِيامَةِ ولِوَجهِهِ نُورٌ مَدَّ البَصَرِ ، يَعرِفُهُ الخَلايِقُ باسمِهِ ونَسَبِهِ
hadiths.english: 6267. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever testifies with a true testimony wanting to uphold the rights of a Muslim person, he will come on the Day of Resurrection and his face will reflect a light as far as the eye can see, and all of creation will know him by name and lineage.'

hadiths.arabic: 6268. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّ على‏ كُلِّ حَقٍّ حَقيقَةً ، وعلى‏ كُلِّ صَوابٍ نُوراً
hadiths.english: 6268. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'To every truth there is a reality, and for every good thing there is a light.'

sections.section_title_en: THE LIGHT ON THE DAY OF RESURRECTION

hadiths.arabic: 6269. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - لِرجُلٍ قالَ : اُحِبُّ أن اُحشَرَ يَومَ القِيامَةِ في النُّورِ - : لا تَظلِمْ أحَداً تُحشَرْ يَومَ القِيامَةِ في النُّورِ
hadiths.english: 6269. The Prophet (SAWA), to a man who said, 'I would love to be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection in the light', said, 'Do not oppress anyone and you will be resurrected on the Day of Judgment in [with] light.'

hadiths.arabic: 6270. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : النّاسُ كالشَّجَرِ ؛ شَرابُهُ واحِدٌ وثَمَرُهُ مُختَلِفٌ
hadiths.english: 6270. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'People are like trees, their drink is one but their fruits are different.'

hadiths.arabic: 6271. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : ثَلاثَةُ أشياءَ يَحتاجُ النّاسُ طُرّاً إلَيها : الأمنُ ، والعَدلُ ، والخِصبُ
hadiths.english: 6271. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'There are three things that all people need: security, justice, and comfort.'

hadiths.arabic: 6272. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: علَيكُم بالأشكالِ مِن النّاسِ والأوساطِ مِن النّاسِ ، فعِندَهُم تَجِدون مَعادِنَ الجَوهر
hadiths.english: 6272. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'You should heed those similar to you and those of the middle class, for it is there that you will find the sources of jewels.

sections.section_title_en: THE EQUALITY OF PEOPLE IN RIGHTS

hadiths.arabic: 6273. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : النّاسُ سَواءٌ كأسنانِ المُشطِ
hadiths.english: 6273. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'People are as equal as the teeth of a comb.'

hadiths.arabic: 6274. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : النّاسُ في الحَقِّ سَواءٌ
hadiths.english: 6274. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'People are equal to one another in rights.'

hadiths.arabic: 6275. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : النّاسُ إلى‏ آدَمَ شَرعٌ سَواءٌ
hadiths.english: 6275. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'People up to Adam are all equal.'

hadiths.arabic: 6276. شرح نهج البلاغة عن أبي إسحاقِ الهمْداني : أنّ امرَأتَينِ أتَتا عَليّاً عليه السلام ، إحداهُما مِن العَرَبِ والاُخرى‏ مِن المَوالي فَسألَتاه، فَدَفَعَ إلَيهِما دَراهِمَ وطَعاماً بالسَّواء فقالَت إحداهُما : إنّي امرأةٌ مِن العَرَبِ وهذهِ مِن العَجَمِ! فقالَ : إنّي واللَّهِ لا أجِدُ لِبَني إسماعيلَ في هذا الفَي‏ءِ فَضلاً على‏ بَني إسحاقَ
hadiths.english: 6276. Sharh Nahj al-Balagha: 'Two women came to Imam Ali, one of them was an Arab and the other was a non-Arab. They asked him for assistance. He equally gave money and food to them. One of them protested, saying, 'I am an Arab woman, and she is a non-Arab.' He said, 'By Allah, I do not see in this shade that the children of Ishmael have any merit over the children of Isaac.'

sections.section_title_en: THOSE WHO ARE NOT CONSIDERED AS PEOPLE [HUMAN]

hadiths.arabic: 6277. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لرجُلٍ قالَ لَهُ : أتَرى‏ هذا الخَلقَ كُلُّهُ مِن النّاسِ ؟- : اِلقَ مِنهُمُ التّارِكَ للسِّواكِ ، والمُتَرَبِّعَ في مَوضِعِ الضِّيقِ ، والدّاخِلَ فيما لايَعنيهِ، والمُماريَ فيما لاعِلمَ لَهُ، والمُتَمَرِّضَ مِن‏غَيرِ عِلَّةٍ، والمُتَشَعِّثَ‏مِن غَيرِ مُصيبَةٍ، والمُخالِفَ على‏ أصحابِهِ في الحَقِّ وقَدِ اتَّفَقوا علَيهِ، والمُفتَخِرَ يَفتَخِرُ بآبائهِ وهُو خِلْوٌ مِن صالِحِ أعمالِهِم، فهُو بمَنزِلَةِ الخَلَنجِ‏ يُقشَرُ لِحاءً عَن لِحاءٍ حتّى‏ يُوصَلَ إلى‏ جَوهَريَّتِهِ ، وهُو كما قالَ اللَّهُ عَزَّوجلَّ : (إنْ هُمْ إلّا كالأنْعامِ بَلْ هُمْ أضَلُّ سَبيلاً)
hadiths.english: 6277. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), to a man who asked, 'Do you consider all these creatures as people?' said, 'Exclude from among them those who do not brush their teeth, sitting cross-legged in a narrow place, one who interferes in matters that do not concern him, debates about that which he has no knowledge, one who acts sick without an illness, one who falls apart without a calamity, one who opposes his friends in matters of truth that they have agreed upon, a proud person who is proud of his forefathers but he is devoid of their good deeds, so he is like a heath peeling off its bark bit by bit until it reaches its core, and he is like Allah's verse:“They are like cattle; rather they are more astray” .

hadiths.arabic: 6278. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام لِفَضلِ ابنِ يُونُسَ : أبلِغْ خَيراً ، وقُلْ خَيراً ولا تَكُن إمَّعَةً قلتُ : وما الإمَّعَةُ ؟ قالَ : لا تَقُلْ : أنا مَعَ النّاسِ ، وأنا كَواحِدٍ مِن النّاسِ إنّ رسولَ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله قالَ : يا أيُّها النّاسُ، إنّما هُما نَجدانِ : نَجدُ خَيرٍ ونَجدُ شَرٍّ، فلا يَكُن نَجدُ الشَّرِّ أحَبَّ إلَيكُم مِن نَجدِ الخَيرِ
hadiths.english: 6278. Imam al-Kazim (AS), to Fadl b. Yunus said, 'Do good and speak only good, and do not be an opportunist.' I asked, 'What does it mean to be an opportunist?' He said, 'Do not say:“I am with the people and I am one of the people.” The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'O people, there are two paths: the path of good and the path of evil, so the path of evil should not be more loved by you than the path of good.'

hadiths.arabic: 6279. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : النَّومُ أخُو المَوتِ ، ولا يَموتُ أهلُ الجَنَّةِ
hadiths.english: 6279. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Sleep is the brother of death, and the people of Heaven do not die.'

hadiths.arabic: 6280. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : إنَّ النَّومَ سُلطانُ الدِّماغِ ، وهُو قِوامُ الجَسَدِ وقُوَّتُهُ
hadiths.english: 6280. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'Sleep is the sultan of the brain, and it is the foundation of the body and its [source of] strength.'

hadiths.arabic: 6281. الإمامُ الهادي عليه السلام : السَّهَرُ ألَذُّ لِلمَنامِ
hadiths.english: 6281. Imam al-Hadi (AS) said, 'Staying awake makes sleeping more sweet.'

hadiths.arabic: 6282. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : قالَ موسى‏ عليه السلام : أيُّ عِبادِكَ أبغَضُ إلَيكَ ؟ قالَ : جِيفَةٌ باللَّيل ، بَطّالٌ بالنَّهارِ
hadiths.english: 6282. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Moses (AS) asked [Allah], 'Who from among Your servants is most hated by You?' He Almighty said, '[One who is] a carcass at night and idle [jobless] during the day.'

hadiths.arabic: 6283. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إيّاكُم وكَثرَةَ النَّومِ ؛ فإنَّ كَثرَةَ النَّومِ يَدَعُ صاحِبَهُ فَقيراً يَومَ القِيامَةِ
hadiths.english: 6283. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Beware of too much sleep, for excessive sleep will render one poor on the Day of Judgment.'

hadiths.arabic: 6284. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن خافَ البَياتَ قَلَّ نَومُهُ
hadiths.english: 6284. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'He who fears a nightly raid will sleep little.'

hadiths.arabic: 6285. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما أنقَضَ النَّومَ لعَزائمِ اليَومِ !
hadiths.english: 6285. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'How very much does sleep [at night] unravel the firm determinations made during the day!'

hadiths.arabic: 6286. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: كَثرَةُ النَّومِ مَذهَبَةٌ للدِّينِ والدُّنيا
hadiths.english: 6286. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Excessive sleeping takes away religion and world.'

hadiths.arabic: 6287. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : لا تُعَوِّدْ عَينَيكَ كَثرَةَ النَّومِ ؛ فإنّها أقَلُّ شَي‏ءٍ في الجَسَدِ شُكراً
hadiths.english: 6287. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Do not habituate your eyes to too much sleep, for it is the least thankful in the body.'

hadiths.arabic: 6288. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إنّ اللَّهَ جَلَّ وعَزَّ يُبغِضُ العَبدَ النَّوّامَ الفارِغَ
hadiths.english: 6288. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, 'Allah, the Exalted and Noble, hates a servant who excessively sleeps and is idle.'

hadiths.arabic: 6289. الإمامُ العسكريُّ عليه السلام : مَن أكثَرَ المَنامَ رأَى الأحلامَ
hadiths.english: 6289. Imam al-Askari (AS) said, 'He who sleeps too much sees [disturbing] dreams.'

sections.section_title_ar: صُعودُ روحِ المُومِنِ عِندَ النَّومِ إلَى السَّماءِ
sections.section_title_en: THE ASCENSION OF SPIRITS TO THE SKY DURING SLEEP

hadiths.arabic: 6290. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا يَنامُ المُسلمُ وهُو جُنُبٌ ، ولا يَنامُ إلّا على‏ طَهورٍ ، فإن لَم يَجِدِ الماءَ فلْيَتَيمَّمْ بالصَّعيدِ ؛ فإنَّ رُوحَ المُؤمنِ تَروحُ إلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ فَيَلقاها ويُبارِكُ علَيها ، فإن كانَ أجَلُها قَد حَضَرَ جَعَلَها في مَكنونِ رَحمَتِهِ ، وإن لَم يَكُن أجَلُها قَد حَضَرَ بَعَثَ بِها مَعَ اُمَنائهِ مِن مَلائكَتهِ فيَرُدُّوها في جَسَدِهِ
hadiths.english: 6290. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'A Muslim will not sleep while in a state of ritual impurity (janaba), and he should not sleep without being in a state of purity. If he does not find water then he should perform dry ablution (tayammum) with soil, for the spirit of a believer ascends to Allah Almighty and He meets it and blesses it. If his time of death was to have come when in a state [of purity], He places his spirit within the folds of His Mercy, and if his end has not come He sends it back [i.e. his spirit] with His guardian angels and they return it to his body.'

hadiths.arabic: 6291. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا يَبيتَنَّ أحَدُكُم ويَدُهُ غَمرَةٌ ، فإن فَعَلَ فأصابَهُ لَمَمٌ لِلشَّيطانِ فلا يَلُومَنَّ إلّا نَفسَهُ
hadiths.english: 6291. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'None of you should go to sleep with unclean hands, for if he does and is stricken with mental derangement from Satan [as a result] then he has only himself to blame.'

hadiths.arabic: 6292. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن نامَ علَى الوُضوءِ إن أدرَكَهُ المَوتُ في لَيلِهِ فهُو عِندَ اللَّهِ شَهيدٌ
hadiths.english: 6292. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever sleeps with ablution [wudu?] and dies in his sleep is regarded by Allah as a martyr.'

hadiths.arabic: 6293. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن تَطَهَّرَ ثُمّ أوى‏ إلى‏ فِراشِهِ باتَ وفِراشُهُ كمَسجِدِهِ
hadiths.english: 6293. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Whoever purifies himself [ablution] and then goes to his bed, he will sleep and his bed will be like his mosque.'

hadiths.arabic: 6294. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن تَطَهَّرَ ثُمّ أوى‏ إلى‏ فِراشِهِ ، باتَ وفِراشُهُ كمَسجِدِهِ ، فإن ذَكرَ أ نّهُ على‏ غَيرِ وُضوءٍ فلْيَتَيمَّمْ مِن دِثارِهِ كائناً ما كانَ ، فإن فَعَلَ ذلكَ لَم يَزَلْ في الصَّلاةِ وذِكرِ اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ
hadiths.english: 6294. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Whoever purifies himself [ablution] and then goes to his bed he will sleep and his bed will be like his mosque. So, if he remembers that he is not in a state of ablution, then he should perform dry ablution (tayammum) on his clothes, whatever it may be, and if he does so he will be [regarded as] continuously praying and remembering Allah Almighty.'

hadiths.arabic: 6295. الإمامُ عليٍّ عليه السلام لابنه الحسن عليه السلام : يا بُنَيَّ ، ألا اُعَلِّمُكَ أربَعَ خِصالٍ تَستَغني بِها عَنِ الطِّبِّ ؟ فقالَ : بلى‏ يا أميرَ المؤمنينَ قالَ : لا تَجلِسْ علَى الطَّعامِ إلّا وأنتَ جائعٌ ، ولا تَقُمْ عَنِ الطَّعامِ إلّا وأنتَ تَشتَهيهِ ، وجَوِّدِ المَضغَ ، وإذا نِمتَ فاعرِضْ نَفسَكَ علَى الخَلاءِ ، فإذا استَعمَلتَ هذا استَغنَيتَ عَنِ الطِّبِّ
hadiths.english: 6295. Imam Ali (AS), to his son al-Hasan (AS) said, 'O son, shall I teach you four things that will make you needless of medicine?' He said, 'Yes, O Commander of the Faithful.' He said, 'Do not eat food unless you are hungry and get up from eating whilst you still desire to eat more, chew well, and before you sleep go and relieve yourself. If you do these you will be needless of medicine.'

hadiths.arabic: 6296. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إذا أوَيتَ إلى‏ فِراشِكَ فانظُرْ ما سَلَكتَ في بَطنِكَ وما كَسَبتَ في يَومِكَ ، واذكُرْ أ نَّكَ مَيِّتٌ وأنَّ لكَ مَعاداً
hadiths.english: 6296. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'When you head for bed then look at what you have put in your stomach [during the day] and what you have earned in your day, and remember that you are to die and that you will be resurrected.'

hadiths.arabic: 6297. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: مَن قَرَأَ (قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أحَدٌ) حِينَ يأخُذُ مَضجَعَهُ ، غَفَرَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وجَلَّ لَهُ ذُنوبَ خَمسينَ سَنَةً
hadiths.english: 6297. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever recites the chapter of the Qur'an entitled al-Ikhlas when he retires to his bed, Allah will forgive fifty years of his sins.'

hadiths.arabic: 6298. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن قَرأَ (ألْهاكُمُ التَّكاثُرُ) عِندَ مَنامِهِ وُقِيَ فِتنَةَ القَبرِ
hadiths.english: 6298. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever recites the chapter of the Qur'an entitled al-Takathur when going to sleep will be protected from the trials of the grave.'

hadiths.arabic: 6299. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا آوى‏ أحَدُكُم إلى‏ فِراشِهِ لِيَقُلْ : اللّهُمّ إن أمسَكتَ نَفسي في مَنامي فاغفِرْ لَها ، وإن أرسَلتَها فاحفَظْها بما تَحفَظُ بهِ عِبادَكَ الصّالِحينَ
hadiths.english: 6299. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'When any of you retires to his bed he should say: O Allah, if You take my soul while I am sleeping then forgive it, and if You send it back to me, then protect it as You protect Your righteous servants.'

hadiths.arabic: 6300. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : النَّومُ على‏ أربَعَةِ أوجُهٍ : الأنبياءُ عليهم السلام تَنامُ على‏ أقفِيَتِهِم مُستَلقِينَ وأعيُنُهُم لا تَنامُ مُتَوَقِّعَةً لِوَحيِ اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ ، والمُؤمنُ يَنامُ على‏ يَمينهِ مُستَقبِلَ القِبلَةِ ، والمُلوكُ وأبناؤها تَنامُ على‏ شَمائلها لِيَستَمرئوا ما يأكُلونَ ، وإبليسُ وإخوانُهُ وكُلُّ مَجنونٍ وذوعاهَةٍ يَنامُ على‏ وَجهِهِ مُنبَطِحاً
hadiths.english: 6300. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Sleeping can be in four ways: prophets (AS) sleep straight on their backs and their eyes do not sleep waiting for the revelation of Allah. The believer sleeps on his right side facing the qibla. Kings and their children sleep on their left side enjoying what they ate. Satan, his brethren and every insane and deformed person sleeps flat on their front.'

hadiths.arabic: 6301. بحار الأنوار : إنَّ النَّبيَّ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله كانَ إذا آوى‏ إلى‏ فِراشِهِ قالَ : «باسمِكَ اللّهُمّ أمُوتُ وأحيا» ، وإذا استَيقَظَ قالَ : «الحَمدُ للَّهِ الّذي أحيانا بَعدَما أماتَنا وإلَيهِ النُّشورُ»
hadiths.english: 6301. Hudhayfa said, 'When the Prophet (SAWA) retired to his bed he would say, 'In Your name O Allah I die and live', and when he woke up he would say, 'Praise be to Allah who revived us after He caused us to die, and upon Him is the Resurrection.'

sections.section_title_en: THE ROLE OF INTENTION IN THE HEREAFTER

hadiths.arabic: 6307. الكافي عن الإمام الصّادق عليه السلام : إنّما خُلِّدَ أهلُ النّارِ في النّارِ لأنّ نِيّاتِهِم كانَت في الدُّنيا أن لَو خُلِّدوا فيها أن يَعصُوا اللَّهَ أبداً ، وإنّما خُلِّدَ أهلُ الجَنّةِ في الجَنّةِ لأنّ نِيّاتِهِم كانَت في الدُّنيا أن لَو بَقُوا فيها أن يُطِيعوا اللَّهَ أبَداً ، فبِالنِّيّاتِ خُلِّدَ هؤلاءِ وهؤلاءِ ، ثُمّ تَلا قولَهُ تعالى‏ : (قُلْ كُلٌّ يَعْمَلُ عَلى‏ شاكِلَتِهِ) قالَ : على‏ نِيَّتِهِ
hadiths.english: 6307. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The people of Hell will dwell eternally in Hell because their intentions in the world were such that if they were to remain there forever they would disobey Allah forever, and the people of Heaven will dwell eternally in Heaven because their intentions in the world were such that if they were to remain there forever, they would obey Allah. Therefore, it is according to their intentions that these people and those people will have everlasting abodes. He then recited Allah's verse in the Qur'an: “Say, 'Everyone acts according to his character' , and said, [meaning] 'With his intention.'

hadiths.arabic: 6308. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ اللَّهَ يَحشُرُ النّاسَ على‏ نِيّاتِهِم يَومَ القِيامَةِ
hadiths.english: 6308. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Allah will resurrect people according to their intentions on the Day of Judgment.'

sections.section_title_en: THE REWARD OF AN INTENTION TO DO GOOD

hadiths.arabic: 6309. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : تَرَكنا في المَدينَةِ أقواماً لا نَقطَعُ وادِياً ولا نَصعَدُ صُعوداً ولا نَهبِطُ هُبوطاً إلّا كانُوا مَعَنا قالُوا : كَيفَ يَكونونَ مَعَنا ولَم يَشهَدوا ؟! قالَ : نِيّاتُهُم
hadiths.english: 6309. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'We left groups of people in Madinah, while there was no valley we crossed nor heights we climbed nor hills we descended without them being with us. They said, 'How can they be with us when they did not witness any of this?' He said, '[Because of] their intentions.'

hadiths.arabic: 6310. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يا أبا ذرٍّ ، هِمَّ بالحَسَنَةِ وإن لَم تَعمَلْها ، لِكَيلا تُكتَبَ مِن الغافِلينَ
hadiths.english: 6310. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'O Abu Dharr, intend to do good, even if you do not [manage to] do it so that you are not written among the inattentive.'

hadiths.arabic: 6311. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : النِّيَّةُ الصّالِحَةُ أحَدُ العَمَلَينِ
hadiths.english: 6311. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Righteous intention is one of the two actions [it itself is a deed].'

hadiths.arabic: 6312. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - لِرجُلٍ يَوَدُّ حُضورَ أخيهِ ليَشهَدَ نَصرَ اللَّهِ على‏ أعدائهِ في الجَمَلِ - : أهَوى‏ أخيكَ مَعَنا ؟ فقالَ : نَعَم ، قالَ : فَقد شَهِدَنا ، ولَقد شَهِدَنا في عَسكَرِنا هذا أقوامٌ (قَومٌ) في أصلابِ الرِّجالِ وأرحامِ النِّساءِ ، سَيَرعَفُ بِهِمُ الزَّمانُ‏ ، ويَقوى‏ بِهِمُ الإيمانُ
hadiths.english: 6312. Imam Ali (AS) said to a man who wished his brother was present so that he could see the victory of Allah over His enemies at the Battle of the Camel, 'Did your brother desire to be with us?' He said, 'Yes.' He (AS) said, 'Then he has witnessed us, and groups of people have witnessed us in our army while they are still in the loins of men and the wombs of women. Very soon time will bring them out and faith will become strong through them.'

hadiths.arabic: 6313. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : على‏ قَدرِ النِّيَّةِ تَكونُ مِن اللَّهِ العَطِيَّةُ
hadiths.english: 6313. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Allah's granting [of rewards] is according to the intention.'

hadiths.arabic: 6314. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إذا عَلِمَ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ حُسنَ نِيَّةٍ مِن أحَدٍ ، اكتَنَفَهُ بالعِصمَةِ
hadiths.english: 6314. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'When Allah Almighty knows the good intention of someone He encompasses him with protection [from sins].'

sections.section_title_en: THE INTENTION OF THE BELIEVER IS BETTER THAN HIS ACTION

hadiths.arabic: 6315. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : نِيَّةُ المُؤمنِ خَيرٌ مِن عَمَلِهِ ، ونِيَّةُ الكافِرِ شَرٌّ مِن عَمَلِهِ، وكُلُّ عامِلٍ يَعمَلُ على‏ نِيَّتِهِ
hadiths.english: 6315. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The intention of the believer is better than his action, and the intention of the disbeliever is worse than his action, and every doer does according to his intention.'

hadiths.arabic: 6316. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : نِيَّةُ المُؤمنِ أبلَغُ مِن عَمَلِهِ ، وكذلكَ الفاجِرُ
hadiths.english: 6316. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The intention of a believer is more effective than his action, and same with the evildoer.'

hadiths.arabic: 6317. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : نِيَّةُ المُؤمنِ أفضَلُ مِن عَمَلِهِ ؛ وذلكَ لأ نّهُ يَنوي مِن الخَيرِ ما لا يُدرِكُهُ ، ونِيَّةُ الكافِرِ شَرٌّ مِن عَمَلِهِ ؛ وذلكَ لأنَّ الكافِرَ يَنوي الشَّرَّ ويأمَلُ مِن الشَّرِّ ما لا يُدرِكُهُ
hadiths.english: 6317. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'The intention of a believer is better than his action, that is because he intends good that he cannot perform, and the intention of the disbeliever is worse than his action because he intends evil and he wishes in evil what he cannot perform.'

hadiths.arabic: 6318. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - في الجَوابِ عَن عِلَّةِ فَضلِ نِيَّةِ المُؤمنِ على‏ عَملِهِ - : لأنَّ العَمَلَ رُبَّما كانَ‏رِياءً لِلمَخلوقينَ، والنِّيَّةُ خالِصَةٌ لرَبِّ العالَمينَ، فيُعطي تَعالى‏ علَى النِّيَّةِ ما لا يُعطي علَى العَمَلِ
hadiths.english: 6318. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), in answer to the reason behind the superiority of a believer's intention over his action, 'Because an action could be done as an act of showing-off, but the intention is solely and sincerely for the Lord of the worlds, so He Almighty gives according to the intention what He does not give for the action.'

sections.section_title_ar: الحَثُّ عَلَى النِّيَّةِ الصّالحَةِ في كُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ
sections.section_title_en: ENJOINMENT OF RIGHTEOUS INTENTIONS IN EVERYTHING

hadiths.arabic: 6319. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يا أبا ذرٍّ ، لِيَكُن لَكَ في كُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ نِيَّةٌ صالِحَةٌ ، حتّى‏ في النَّومِ والأكلِ
hadiths.english: 6319. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'O Abu Dharr, you should have a righteous intention in everything you do, even in sleeping and eating.'

hadiths.arabic: 6320. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: لابُدَّ لِلعَبدِ مِن خالِصِ النِّيَّةِ في كُلِّ حَرَكَةٍ وسُكونٍ ؛ لأ نَّهُ إذا لَم يَكُن هذا المَعنى‏ يَكونُ غافِلاً
hadiths.english: 6320. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'It is important for a servant to have sincere intention in every movement and stillness, for if it was not so he would be regarded as negligent.'

hadiths.arabic: 6321. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أفضَلُ العَمَلِ النِّيَّةُ الصّادِقَةُ
hadiths.english: 6321. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The best action is the true intention.'

hadiths.arabic: 6322. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : حُسنُ النِّيَّةِ جَمالُ السَّرائرِ
hadiths.english: 6322. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The good intention is the beauty of the hearts.'

hadiths.arabic: 6323. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : جَميلُ النِّيَّةِ سَبَبٌ لِبُلوغِ الاُمنِيَّةِ
hadiths.english: 6323. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'The beautiful intention is the reason for the fulfilment of ambition.'

hadiths.arabic: 6324. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن حَسُنَت نِيَّتُهُ زادَ اللَّهُ في رِزقِهِ
hadiths.english: 6324. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Allah will increase the sustenance of he whose intention is good.'

hadiths.arabic: 6325. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عن حَدِّ العِبادَةِ التي إذا فَعَلَها فاعِلُها كانَ مُؤدِّياً - : حُسنُ النِّيَّةِ بالطّاعَةِ
hadiths.english: 6325. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), when asked about the limit of worship required by a person for him to be considered as fulfilling it, said, 'Good intention with obedience.'

hadiths.arabic: 6326. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : سُوءُ النِّيَّةِ داءٌ دَفينٌ
hadiths.english: 6326. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Bad intention is a hidden sickness.'

hadiths.arabic: 6327. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: عِندَ فَسادِ النِّيَّةِ تَرتَفِعُ البَرَكَةُ
hadiths.english: 6327. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'With corrupt intentions blessings are removed.'

hadiths.arabic: 6328. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: إذا فَسَدَتِ النِّيَّةُ وَقَعَتِ البَلِيَّةُ
hadiths.english: 6328. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'When an intention is corrupt calamity befalls.'

hadiths.arabic: 6329. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ المُؤمنَ لَيَنوي الذَّنبَ فيُحرَمُ رِزقَهُ
hadiths.english: 6329. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'A believer makes an intention to sin, and he is deprived of sustenance [as a result].'

hadiths.arabic: 6302. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يا أيُّها النّاسُ، إنّما الأعمالُ بالنِّيّاتِ ، وإنّما لِكُلِّ امرئٍ ما نَوى‏ ، فمَن كانَت هِجرَتُهُ إلَى اللَّهِ ورَسولِهِ فهِجرَتُهُ إلَى اللَّهِ ورَسولِهِ ، ومَن كانَت هِجرَتُهُ إلى‏ دُنيا يُصيبُها أوِ امرأةٍ يَتَزَوَّجُها فهِجرَتُهُ إلى‏ ما هاجَرَ إلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 6302. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'O people, actions are according to intentions, and every person will have what he intended. So, whoever's migration was to Allah and His Messenger then his migration is to Allah and His Messenger, and whoever's migration was to the world to gain from it, or to a woman to marry her, then their migration will be to whatever they migrated to.'

hadiths.arabic: 6303. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - لَمّا أغزى‏ علِيّاً عليه السلام فيِ سَرِيَّةٍ ، فقالَ رجُلٌ لأخٍ لَهُ : اُغْزُ بِنا في سَرِيّةِ علِيٍّ لَعلَّنا نُصيبُ خادِماً أو دابَّةً أو شَيئاً نَتَبَلَّغُ بهِ - : إنّما الأعمالُ بالنِّيّاتِ ، ولكُلِّ امرئٍ ما نَوى‏ ، فمَن غَزا ابتِغاءَ ما عِندَ اللَّهِ فَقد وَقَعَ أجرُهُ علَى اللَّهِ ، ومَن غَزا يُريدُ عَرَضَ الدُّنيا أو نَوى‏ عِقالاً لَم يَكُن لَهُ إلّا ما نَوى‏
hadiths.english: 6303. The Prophet (SAWA), when he sent Ali on a military expedition with a brigade, and a man said to his brother, 'Lets go on the military expedition with the brigade of Ali, we might get a slave or an animal or something of value- said, 'Actions are according to intentions, and every person has what they intend. So whoever goes on a conquest in search of what is with Allah then their reward will be from Allah, and whoever goes on a conquest in search of worldly affairs or intends restraints will not get other than what he intended.'

hadiths.arabic: 6304. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : النِّيَّةُ أساسُ العَمَلِ
hadiths.english: 6304. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Intention is the basis of action.'

hadiths.arabic: 6305. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام : لا عَمَلَ إلّا بِنِيَّةٍ
hadiths.english: 6305. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, 'There is no action without intention.'

hadiths.arabic: 6306. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : ما ضَعُفَ بَدَنٌ عمّا قَوِيَت علَيهِ النِّيَّةُ
hadiths.english: 6306. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'A body will not become weak where the intention is strong.'

hadiths.arabic: 6330. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أيُّها النّاس، هاجِروا وتَمَسَّكوا بالإسلامِ ؛ فإنَّ الهِجرَةَ لا تَنقَطِعُ ما دامَ الجِهادُ
hadiths.english: 6330. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'O people, migrate and hold fast on to Islam, for migration does not stop as long as struggle exists.'

hadiths.arabic: 6331. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الهِجرَةُ هِجرَتانِ : إحداهُما أن تَهجُرَ السَّيّئاتِ ، والاُخرى‏ أن تُهاجِرَ إلَى اللَّهِ تعالى‏ ورَسولِهِ ، ولا تَنقَطِعُ الهِجرَةُ ما تُقُبِّلَتِ التَّوبَةُ
hadiths.english: 6331. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'There are two migrations: one of them is that you migrate away from bad deeds, and the other one is your migration to Allah Almighty and His Messenger, and migration does not stop as long as repentance is accepted.'

hadiths.arabic: 6332. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الهِجرَةُ قائمَةٌ على‏ حَدِّها الأوَّلِ ، ماكانَ للَّهِ في أهلِ الأرضِ حاجَةٌ مِن مُستَسَرِّ الاُمَّةِ ومُعلَنِها، لا يَقَعُ اسمُ الهِجرَةِ على‏ أحَدٍ (إلّا) بمَعرِفَةِ الحُجَّةِ في الأرضِ ، فمَن عَرَفَها وأقَرَّ بها فهُو مُهاجِرٌ ، ولا يَقَعُ اسمُ الاستِضعافِ على‏ مَن بَلَغَتهُ الحُجَّةُ فسَمِعَتها اُذُنُهُ ووَعاها قَلبُهُ
hadiths.english: 6332. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Migration stands at its original position. Allah has no need of him who secretly accepts belief or him who openly does so. Migration will not apply to anyone unless he recognises the proof [of Allah - an Imam] on the earth. Whoever recognises him and acknowledges him is a migrant. The title 'weak' does not apply to him whom the proof [of Allah] has reached, and he hears it and his heart comprehends it.'

hadiths.arabic: 6333. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : مَن دَخَلَ في الإسلامِ طَوعاً فهُو مُهاجِرٌ
hadiths.english: 6333. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'He who willingly enters Islam is a migrant.'

hadiths.arabic: 6334. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أفضَلُ الهِجرَةِ أن تَهجُرَ ما كَرِهَ اللَّهُ
hadiths.english: 6334. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The best migration is that you abandon all that Allah hates.'

hadiths.arabic: 6335. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: أفضَلُ الهِجرَةِ أن تَهجُرَ السُّوءَ
hadiths.english: 6335. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'The best migration is that you abandon all bad.'

hadiths.arabic: 6336. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : المُهاجِرُ مَن هَجَرَ الخَطايا والذُّنوبَ
hadiths.english: 6336. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A migrant is someone who migrates from wrongs and sins.'

sections.section_title_ar: وُجوبُ الهِجرَةِ عَن بِلادِ أهلِ المَعاصي‏
sections.section_title_en: THE NECESSITY OF MIGRATING FROM PLACES [POPULATED WITH] SINNERS

hadiths.arabic: 6337. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - في قولِهِ تعالى‏ : (يا عِباديَ الّذِينَ آمَنوا إنَّ اَرضي ...) - : إذا عُصِيَ اللَّهُ في أرضٍ أنتَ فيها فاخرُجْ مِنها إلى‏ غَيرِها
hadiths.english: 6337. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), with regard to Allah's verse in the Qur'an:“O My servants who have faith! My earth is indeed vast. So worship [only] Me” , said, 'When Allah is disobeyed in a place that you are in, leave it and go somewhere else.'

hadiths.arabic: 6338. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن فَرَّ بدِينِهِ مِن أرضٍ إلى‏ أرضٍ وإن كانَ شِبراً مِن الأرضِ ، استَوجَبَ الجَنّةَ وكانَ رَفيقَ إبراهيمَ ومحمّدٍ
hadiths.english: 6338. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Whoever flees with their religion from one place to another, even if it was the distance of a hand's span of the earth, Heaven becomes obligatory for him and he will be in the company of Abraham and Muhammad (AS).'

sections.section_title_en: PROHIBITION OF RETURNING TO [A STATE OF] RENEGATION AFTER HAVING MIGRATED [TO BELIEF] (AL-TAARRUB BAD AL-HIJRA)

hadiths.arabic: 6339. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - في وصيَّتِهِ لعليٍّ عليه السلام - : لا تَعَرُّبَ بَعدَ الهِجرَةِ
hadiths.english: 6339. The Prophet (SAWA), in his will to Ali (AS) said, 'There is no renegation after migration.'

hadiths.arabic: 6340. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: مِنَ الكَبائِرِ قَتلُ المُؤمِنِ عَمداً... وَالتَّعرُّبُ بَعدَ الهِجرَةِ
hadiths.english: 6340. Imam Ali (AS) said, 'Among the major sins is the intentional killing of a believer...and regeneration after migration.'

hadiths.arabic: 6341. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : المُتَعَرِّبُ بَعدَ الهِجرَةِ التّارِكُ لهذا الأمرِ بَعدَ مَعرِفَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 6341. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'The one who returns to a state of renegation after migration [to belief] is one who abandons this affair [of Islam] after having acknowledged it.'

hadiths.arabic: 6342. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ التَّعَرُّبَ بَعدَ الهِجرَةِ للرُّجوعِ عَنِ الدِّينِ وتَركِ المُوازَرَةِ للأنبياءِ والحُجَجِ عليهم السلام، وما في ذلِكَ مِن الفَسادِ وإبطالِ حَقِّ كُلِّ ذي حَقٍّ لِعِلَّةِ سُكنَى البَدوِ ؛ ولذلكَ لَو عَرَفَ الرّجُلُ الدِّينَ كامِلاً لَم يَجُزْ لَهُ مُساكَنَةُ أهلِ الجَهلِ، والخَوفِ علَيهِ؛ لأنّهُ لا يُؤمَنُ أن يَقَعَ مِنهُ تَركُ العِلمِ، والدُّخولُ مَع أهلِ الجَهلِ والتَّمادِي في ذلكَ
hadiths.english: 6342. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, 'Allah has prohibited renegation after migration [to belief] because of [the danger] of denouncing one's religion and leaving the support of the prophets and the divine proofs (AS), and the corruption that would ensue, the nullification of the rights of all those who hold rights [in religion], especially for bedouins. This is why, if a man were to have acknowledged religion completely, it is not allowed for him to go and live with people who are ignorant [or in disbelief] of it, and as a result of fear for him, for he can never be safe from falling from his position of knowledge and re-entering into ignorance and remaining therein.'

hadiths.arabic: 6343. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : هَجرُ المُسلِمِ أخاهُ كَسَفكِ دَمِهِ
hadiths.english: 6343. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'A Muslim's desertion of his brother is like shedding his blood.'

hadiths.arabic: 6344. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يا أبا ذرٍّ ، إيّاكَ وهِجرانَ أخِيكَ ؛ فإنَّ العَمَلَ لا يُتَقَبَّلُ مِن الهِجرانِ
hadiths.english: 6344. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'O Abu Dharr, beware of deserting your brother, for deeds are not accepted from desertion.'

hadiths.arabic: 6345. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لا يَزالُ إبليسُ فَرِحاً ما اهتَجرَ المُسلِمانِ ، فإذا التَقَيا اصطَكَّت رُكبَتاهُ وتَخَلّعَت أوصالُهُ‏ ، ونادَى‏ يا وَيلَهُ ، ما لَقِيَ مِن الثُّبُورِ ؟!
hadiths.english: 6345. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, 'Satan continues to be happy as long as two Muslims forsake each other, and when they reconcile again his knees tremble and his joints break apart, and he screams out 'Woe unto me, I am perished'.'

sections.section_title_ar: النَّهيُ عن هِجرَةِ الأخِ فَوقَ ثَلاثٍ‏
sections.section_title_en: THE PROHIBITION OF FORSAKING A BROTHER FOR MORE THAN THREE DAYS

hadiths.arabic: 6347. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا هِجرَةَ فَوقَ ثَلاثٍ
hadiths.english: 6347. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Forsaking [one's brother] for more than three days is not allowed.'

hadiths.arabic: 6348. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا يَحِلُّ للمُؤمنِ أن يَهجُرَ أخاهُ فَوقَ ثَلاثَةِ أيّامٍ
hadiths.english: 6348. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'It is not permitted for a believer to desert his brother for more than three days.'

hadiths.arabic: 6349. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: لا تَحِلُّ الهِجرَةُ فَوقَ ثَلاثَةِ أيّامٍ ، فإنِ التَقَيا فسَلَّمَ أحَدُهُما فَرَدَّ الآخَرُ اشتَرَكا في الأجرِ ، وإن لَم يَرُدَّ بَرِئَ هذا مِن الإثمِ ، وباءَ بهِ الآخَرُ
hadiths.english: 6349. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Deserting [one's brother] for more than three days is not allowed, and if they meet thereafter and one of them greets the other, and he returns the greeting, they will both share the reward. But if he does not return the greeting, the person who greeted is cleared of sin, and will take the reward alone.'

hadiths.arabic: 6350. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تَدابَرُوا، ولا تَقاطَعُوا، وكُونوا عِبادَ اللَّهِ إخواناً ، هَجرُ المُؤمنَينِ ثَلاثاً ، فإن تَكَلَّما وإلّا أعرَضَ اللَّهُ عَزَّوجلَّ عَنهُما حتّى‏ يَتَكلَّما
hadiths.english: 6350. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'Do not turn your backs to each other and do not cut ties amongst yourselves, and be servants of Allah as brothers. Deserting a believer for [more than] three days [is not allowed] and they must speak [thereafter], but if they do not Allah Almighty turns away from them until they speak.'

hadiths.arabic: 6351. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أيُّما مُسلِمَينِ تَهاجَرا فمَكَثا ثَلاثاً لا يَصطَلِحانِ إلّا كانا خارِجَينِ مِن الإسلامِ ، ولَم يَكُن بَينَهُما وَلايَةٌ ، فأيُّهُما سَبَقَ إلى‏ كلامِ أخيهِ كانَ السّابِقَ إلَى الجَنَّةِ يَومَ الحِسابِ
hadiths.english: 6351. The Prophet (SAWA) said, 'No sooner do two Muslims forsake each other and stay like that for three days without reconciling, then they are regarded as having left Islam and there is no relation between them. Whoever of them precedes in speaking to his brother will precede entrance into Heaven on the Day of Judgment.'

hadiths.arabic: 6352. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : ما مِن مُؤمنَينِ اهتَجَرا فَوقَ ثَلاثٍ إلّا وَبَرِئتُ مِنهُما في الثّالِثَةِ ، فقيلَ لَهُ : يابنَ رسولِ اللَّهِ ، هذا حالُ الظّالِمِ فما بالُ المَظلومِ ؟ فقالَ عليه السلام: ما بالُ المَظلومِ لا يَصيرُ إلَى الظّالِمِ فيَقولُ : أنا الظّالِمُ ، حتّى‏ يَصطَلِحا ؟!
hadiths.english: 6352. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, 'Any two believers who forsake each other for more than three days, I disassociate myself from them on the third day.' He was asked, 'O son of the Prophet, this is in regard to the one wronging, but what about the wronged?' He (SAWA) said, 'Well why doesn't the wronged one himself go to the wronger and say, 'I am in the wrong, until they reconcile?!'

hadiths.arabic: 6353. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - في قولِهِ عَزَّوجلَّ : (إنّا هَدَيْناهُ السَّبيلَ ...) - : عَرَّفناهُ إمّا آخِذاً وإمّا تارِكاً
hadiths.english: 6353. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), with regard to Allah's verse in the Qur'an:“Indeed We have guided him to the way, be he grateful or ungrateful” said, 'We made them know it [i.e. the right way], they can either take it or leave it.'

hadiths.arabic: 6354. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئل عَنِ الآيَةِ - : مَن أخرَجَها مِن ضَلالٍ إلى‏ هُدى‏ فكأنّما أحياها ، ومَن أخرَجَها مِن هُدىً إلى‏ ضَلالٍ فَقد قَتَلَها
